benchmark_details.name: CLIP (Clinical Action Items from Hospital Discharge Notes)
benchmark_details.overview: CLIP is a dataset of clinical action items annotated from hospital discharge notes to assist primary care physicians in identifying actionable information.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assist primary care physicians in extracting and identifying action items from clinical discharge notes.

data.source: Annotated clinical notes from the MIMIC-III database.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed using micro and macro averages.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 and AUC scores indicate better model performance in extracting action items.
methodology.baseline_results: Highest binary F1 score from models approaches 0.86, compared to human agreement of 0.93.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset uses de-identified clinical notes from the MIMIC-III database.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Access to dataset requires completion of an ethics course and a Data Use Agreement.
